Full-Stack Developer

Ocean Data Lab, 2022 Summer

Ocean Data Lab Website: view

My development product: view

Context

In the past, members of the Ocean Data Lab have collected over 1.5GB ocean acoustic data from large underwater networks. Various types of data visualizations are created to better analyze those data. However, Those visualizations requires different inputs such as location, time interval, graph type, etc, to be generated. It will be much convenient to manipulate these required parameters on an interface than writing Python codes.

Responsibility

Created a website where users can select different locations, graph types, and time interval to generate different data visualizations. Website also allows users to download the acoustic data in CSV file based on different requirements.

Takeaway

I chosed a tech combination (React + Flask) that I never tried before. My experience of building the interface highly improves my problem-solving skills and research skills. I got to know Professor Shima and a group of amazing researchers.

Full-stack Developer

Simoni Lab, 2022 Summer

Simoni Lab website: view

Context

The Embrace Sunshine team is building a Wechat-based mini-Program to deliver adherence intervention for people diagnosed with HIV. Furthermore, a management system to manipulate the database is also needed to be developed.

Responsibility

Assisted in building both the front-end and backend of the Embrace Sunshine Wechat Mini-program. Designed and built the front-end interface of the management websit for the Mini-program.

Takeaway

As a developer, I highly improved my ability of communicating and collaborating with the UI teams within a product development pipeline. I also sharpened my front-end programming skills as well as getting to learn new tech contents like AWS cloud storaging and serverless framework.

Employeefind

Simplify your process in finding employees

Website Url: view

Full stack web development

Developed an online human resource website for recruiters to find employees easily.

React front-end

The website is built on top of one of the most popular front-end frameworks React.js. Components are created with MaterialUI.

Mock backend

Currently, we are still working on creating the backend server to serve the need of send data to the front-end website. Thus, All the data shown on the website are now mocked by npm package axios-mock-adapter.

Modern Deployment

The front-end website is currently hosted on Netlify for viewing purpose. When the backend is ready, we will deploy on Amazon AWS EC2.

Ocean Data Lab

Visualize Hydrophone Data

My development work: view

Topic

Designed and developed a responsive website to help visualize and download hydrophone data for Ocean Data Lab led by Professor Shima Abadi

React front-end

The website is built on top of one of the most popular front-end frameworks React.js. UI components are created with MaterialUI, and map is powered by react-map-gl

Flask backend

Many scientific graphs can only be created with the help of Python libraries. Thus, I chose Flask, a micro web framework written in Python, to serve as the backend server for the website.

Modern Deployment

The interactive visualization tool is deployed on AWS EC2 for public usage

Final Project Proposal

This is my HCDE 438 reflection, where I reflect on my experience in the class and the projects I worked on.

Project Proposal: Enhanced Snake Game with Power-ups and Obstacles

In this project, I will enhance the classic snake game by adding power-ups and obstacles to make the game more exciting and challenging. The game will be built using the p5.js library.

Drawing
Descriptions of two versions of my project
1.Prototype Version: contains functional core features for the snake game but with minimal CSS styling and without instructions about the new features. Here are the new features available in the prototype version.

****Power-ups****: The game will have power-ups that appear randomly on the screen and give the snake different abilities or bonuses. Some examples of power-ups include:
  • Speed Boost: Increases the snake's speed for a limited time.
  • Longer Body: Adds extra segments to the snake's body, making it longer.
****Obstacles****: The game will have obstacles that the snake needs to avoid to stay alive. Some examples of obstacles include:
  • Walls: The snake will need to avoid hitting the walls to prevent losing the game.
2. Final Version: The game will have all the functional features, including the new power-up and obstacle features with good color schemes. Detailed instructions introducing the new features will be shown to users before they play the game.
Development Process
Here's a step-by-step overview of how to build my updated gluttonous snake game using p5.js:
  1. Define the scope and requirements of the snake game.
  2. Develop the core functionality of the snake game, including the snake movement and collision detection.
  3. Create a prototype version of the game with minimal CSS styling and without instructions about the new features.
  4. Test the prototype version of the game and gather user feedback.
  5. Incorporate user feedback and develop new power-up and obstacle features, such as speed boost and walls.
  6. Implement good color schemes for the power-ups and obstacles.
  7. Develop detailed instructions introducing the new features for the game.
  8. Test the final version of the game and ensure that all functional features are working properly.
  9. Release the final version of the game to the public.
Here are the two milestones:
  1. Prototype version: contains functional core features for the snake game but with minimal CSS styling and without instructions about the new features. Includes the new power-up and obstacle features, with good color schemes.
  2. Final version: contains all the functional features of the game, including the power-up and obstacle features. Detailed instructions introducing the new features are shown to users before they play the game.
List of unknowns
Here's a list of unknowns:
  1. How to generate power-ups and obstacles randomly on the screen.
  2. How to code the logic for power-ups and obstacles to interact with the snake and affect its behavior.
  3. How to create good color schemes for the power-ups and obstacles.
List of Stretch Goals
  1. Multiplayer mode: Allow multiple players to play the game together online or locally.
  2. Advanced AI opponents: Implement computer-controlled opponents with advanced AI that can challenge the player.
  3. Customizable snake skins: Allow players to customize the appearance of their snake with different skins or patterns.

Thanks for viewing my portfolio.
